definition: present in great quantity

usage.sentence: Markets in the city were booming with abundant supplies of dried, fresh, and processed foods, including milled rice, tofu, crackers, cakes, and meat.
usage.source: Escape from Camp 14: One Man's Remarkable Odyssey from North Korea to Freedom in the West

definition: not counterfeit or copied

usage.sentence: The would-be seller says he believes his sword is authentic, and the Cincinnati sword was a copy.

definition: give entirely to a specific person, activity, or cause

usage.sentence: In order not to become bored, he dedicated himself to the task of repairing the many things that needed fixing in the house.

definition: being effective without wasting time, effort, or expense

usage.sentence: She could easily spend less time on housework if she pushed herself to be faster and more efficient.

definition: lose the right to or lose by some error, offense, or crime

usage.sentence: It meant the princess would become an ordinary citizen as female imperial family members forfeit their royal status upon marriage to a commoner.

definition: a wish or design that you plan to carry out

usage.sentence: I start to guzzle down the water, with no intention of sharing, because I know these kids have water of their own.

definition: dislike intensely; feel disgust toward

usage.sentence: The colonel had never liked the chaplain and now he loathed and distrusted him.

definition: done or made using whatever is available

usage.sentence: The room was mostly taken up by a makeshift desk—an old warehouse door atop stacked fruit crates—piled high with papers.

definition: deficient in amount or quality or extent

usage.sentence: Usually there was a good supply of salt fish kept in barrels, but fish had not been plentiful the past summer, so now the supply was meager.

definition: become aware of through the senses

usage.sentence: When Hazel woke he perceived at once that it was morning—some time after sunrise, by the smell of it.

definition: conspicuous in position or importance

usage.sentence: No one there knew he was a prominent doctor of sociology, with years of experience as a college professor and several well-respected books.

definition: strict; allowing no deviation from a standard

usage.sentence: He measured himself and those around him by an impossibly rigorous moral code.

definition: marked by quiet and caution and secrecy

usage.sentence: But Cristiana surprised me by appearing at my side in her stealthy way.

definition: in complete agreement

usage.sentence: However you decide, your verdict must be unanimous.

definition: confirm the truth of

usage.sentence: Luma took the player cards to Tracy—the referee would need them to verify the identities and ages of the players.
usage.source: Outcasts United: An American Town, a Refugee Team, and One Woman's Quest to Make a Difference

definition: get or gather together

usage.sentence: It had taken her years to save five dollars, she had hoarded pennies to accumulate such a sum.
usage.source: Harriet Tubman: Conductor on the Underground Railroad

definition: promoting or enhancing well-being

usage.sentence: Regular exercise also activates the body and this is beneficial for the brain.

definition: the quality of being intricate and compounded

usage.sentence: Maps are not accurate portraits of the world in all of its complexity.

definition: extend in a different direction

usage.sentence: Once, when the road diverged, Tristran was concerned that they might take the wrong fork.

definition: escape, either physically or mentally

usage.sentence: It’s a wonder you’ve evaded the government for so long—but you can’t hide now, not when your own family or friends are at risk.

definition: exhaust or get tired through overuse or great strain

usage.sentence: He was fatigued, but pleasantly so, as if he had worked hard at some extremely enjoyable task.

definition: overly eager speed and possible carelessness

usage.sentence: I jumped out of bed and began to dress, in great haste, without bothering to shave or even comb my hair.

definition: make sense of; assign a meaning to

usage.sentence: The look on her face was far from friendly, and Shirley did not need a lesson in reading faces to interpret its meaning.
usage.source: In the Year of the Boar and Jackie Robinson

definition: naughtily or annoyingly playful

usage.sentence: “I love her mischievous eyes, her playfulness. She has a very positive spirit as a person.”

definition: be persistent, refuse to stop

usage.sentence: In his first week on the trail, he managed just five miles a day, but he persevered, and by August, when he reached his home state, he was up to a dozen miles a day.

definition: make into a powder by breaking up or cause to become dust

usage.sentence: Weakened by sunlight and pulverized by winds and waves, those plastic products fracture into ever-smaller pieces.

definition: resist doing something

usage.sentence: I know I have my own feelings as to who should be chosen as the leader, but I’ll refrain from saying at this time so as not to influence any decisions.

definition: recall the past

usage.sentence: They reminisced about past Christmases, or, as Francie put it, they talked about olden times.

definition: the state or situation of being alone

usage.sentence: Silence and solitude: she might have been alone in the world.

definition: dangerously unstable and unpredictable

usage.sentence: The ice seemed a treacherous thing to walk on.

definition: come into the possession of something concrete or abstract

usage.sentence: The important thing, the reason he and Mom had decided to acquire this particular piece of property, was that it came with plenty of land to build our new house.

definition: conform oneself to new or different conditions

usage.sentence: Always consider how you might adapt to your surroundings rather than forcing your surroundings to adapt to you.
usage.source: Aru Shah and the End of Time

definition: one after the other

usage.sentence: It was the third consecutive night of fighting between the enemies.

definition: characterized by great firmness of purpose

usage.sentence: In the morning I was stiff and sore and starving—but I was alive, and more determined than ever to finish what I’d started.

definition: marked by complexity and richness of detail

usage.sentence: The streets are crowded with young people in elaborate getups—giant lace skirts, elaborate umbrellas, ten-inch-tall boots, eyelashes that seem miles long, face masks that glow in the dark.

definition: distinguish oneself

usage.sentence: The man who had succeeded his entire life, excelling at everything and failing at nothing, was beaten.
usage.source: Lincoln's Last Days: The Shocking Assassination that Changed America Forever

definition: a tentative insight that is not yet verified or tested

usage.sentence: A hypothesis is a tentative explanation, a proposed answer to the question that underlies your research.

definition: having many complexly arranged elements; elaborate

usage.sentence: The machine was so intricate, so complicated, that he almost got dizzy looking at it.

definition: expressing sorrow

usage.sentence: Sitting down on the ice, he raised his head and howled the most mournful cry I had ever heard.

definition: hopeful that the best will happen in the future

usage.sentence: I had some seed potatoes left; they looked pretty dried up, but I felt so optimistic and energetic I planted them anyway.

definition: cause to feel confident

usage.sentence: Dr. Javid reassured him that I would be taken care of.
usage.source: Malala: The Girl Who Stood Up for Education and Changed the World

definition: a deliberate act of destruction or disruption

usage.sentence: A computer virus was the perfect piece of sabotage: invisible and instantaneous.

definition: not agitated

usage.sentence: She floated, serene and at peace, on a black sea that knew no shore.

definition: of a quantity that can fulfill a need or requirement

usage.sentence: After that every Wednesday a delivery boy brought a basket of food that was quite sufficient for a week.

definition: be unsure or weak

usage.sentence: He tried to sound brave, but his voice wavered.

definition: sufficient for the purpose

usage.sentence: I need adequate rest to do well in school.

definition: reflect deeply on a subject

usage.sentence: Coach Douglas stepped out, leaving Reggie to contemplate what he would do if he were rich and powerful.

definition: cause extensive destruction or ruin utterly

usage.sentence: Agricultural societies are ravaged by famine when drought, fire or earthquake devastates the annual rice or potato crop.
usage.source: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind

definition: estimate the nature, quality, ability or significance of

usage.sentence: The US government is required to consider new science in evaluating whether air pollution rules are strong enough every five years.

definition: anything that contributes causally to a result

usage.sentence: There are multiple factors that determine how long herbs will stay perky, vibrant, and fresh.

definition: childish in behavior or emotional development

usage.sentence: Sometimes like immature kids, we argued, we fought, we bantered or insulted each other.

definition: speak abruptly, especially as an interruption

usage.sentence: I tried to interject, but I couldn’t get a word in.
usage.source: Tristan Strong Punches a Hole in the Sky

definition: remain present although waning or gradually dying

usage.sentence: It’s woodsy and shaded, and the dampness of winter still lingers.
usage.source: A Heart in a Body in the World

definition: help develop; help grow

usage.sentence: It’s great to set goals and nurture hope.

definition: the quality of being exact

usage.sentence: His strong, skilled fingers shaped the signs with loving precision.
usage.source: The Heart is a Lonely Hunter

definition: organized opposition to authority

usage.sentence: There were more soldiers there, standing with rifles at the ready, waiting for some outbreak of rebellion.

definition: the continued use of the same word or word pattern

usage.sentence: It occurred to Calder that there could be hidden information here—after all, codes involved repetition, and the same objects appeared again and again in Vermeer’s work.

definition: having or emitting a high-pitched and sharp tone or tones

usage.sentence: Every now and then it cawed, a loud, shrill cry that made me flinch.
usage.source: Tristan Strong Punches a Hole in the Sky

definition: something visible that represents something invisible

usage.sentence: In the ballet, the swan is a symbol of faithfulness.

definition: the single one of its kind

usage.sentence: She is completely her own unique self and doesn’t care what anyone thinks.
usage.source: Insignificant Events in the Life of a Cactus

definition: clearly revealed to the mind or the senses or judgment

usage.sentence: By midday Jonas’s absence would become apparent, and would be a cause for serious concern.

definition: relating to or arranged according to the order of time

usage.sentence: The book is split into five parts, which proceed roughly in reverse chronological order, beginning in the nineteen-forties and stretching back to the eighteenth century.

definition: the act of making a noisy disturbance

usage.sentence: You wouldn’t believe the amount of chaos and commotion six brothers could create.

definition: a dispute where there is strong disagreement

usage.sentence: To be most effective, she felt, her actions must be seen as a response to an important national issue, not just a local controversy.
usage.source: The Voice That Challenged a Nation: Marian Anderson and the Struggle for Equal Rights

definition: decrease in size, extent, or range

usage.sentence: I was concerned that he would diminish his impact, rather than increase it.

definition: easily ignited

usage.sentence: Around your home, move flammable materials like dried leaves and needles, gas and propane containers and firewood away from all structures.

definition: extremely cold

usage.sentence: A sudden blast of frigid air hits us from the east, and she shivers.

definition: make worse or less effective

usage.sentence: There is no atmosphere surrounding the moon to produce clouds or smog, so our view was impaired only by darkness.
usage.source: Flying to the Moon: An Astronaut's Story

definition: a statement made about the future

usage.sentence: Osh was known for such predictions, most of which came true.

definition: a partiality preventing objective consideration of an issue

usage.sentence: Now I discovered that there was inequality and prejudice in this country that I had already come to love.
usage.source: The Boy on the Wooden Box

definition: express indirectly by an image, form, or model

usage.sentence: Each number represented something different: the six, a ship; the five, a captain; and the four, a crew.

definition: serious and harsh in manner or behavior

usage.sentence: Connor gave me a stern look, like he was my dad.
usage.source: Insignificant Events in the Life of a Cactus

definition: expressing compassion or friendly fellow feelings

usage.sentence: She was nice enough—frank, sincere, and sympathetic.
usage.source: Red Scarf Girl: A Memoir of the Cultural Revolution

definition: unable to be governed or controlled

usage.sentence: Most of the windows on the second floor had been broken by unruly students or in after-hours fights.

definition: marked by diversity or difference

usage.sentence: Their height is variable, ranging between two and four feet of our measure.

definition: cause to be more favorably inclined; gain the good will of

usage.sentence: In order to have a certain type of success, you’re told you have to appease and pacify the audience.

definition: having or showing feelings of unwarranted importance

usage.sentence: I don't care whether people think I'm smug and arrogant.

definition: foster the growth of

usage.sentence: The leaders of the group clearly valued and cultivated the talent of their female members.

definition: mark as different

usage.sentence: The main building was called “the house,” to distinguish it from the cottages.

definition: freed from or not subject to an obligation or liability

usage.sentence: Only children and those who have medical reasons for not being vaccinated are exempt from the new rule.

definition: a feeling of annoyance at being hindered or criticized

usage.sentence: She frowns deeply, shaking her head in frustration.

definition: incapable of being avoided or prevented

usage.sentence: They shivered at the thought of their inevitable fate.

definition: move haltingly and unsteadily

usage.sentence: The minivan lurched to a stop, throwing all four of us forward.

definition: overcome, as with emotions or perceptual stimuli

usage.sentence: The blackness of the sea suddenly overwhelmed her; it was nothing more than a vast emptiness.
usage.source: When the Sea Turned to Silver

definition: marked by defiant disregard for danger or consequences

usage.sentence: It had been reckless and foolish, and yet it had felt good to speak my mind.

definition: draw back, as with fear or pain

usage.sentence: The cold, slimy thing grazed Sheed’s thumb, causing him to recoil and squeal.

definition: bring to an end; settle conclusively

usage.sentence: The problems that remain are serious and must be resolved through negotiations.

definition: having ample room

usage.sentence: We stepped into the kitchen, a large spacious room.

definition: hesitant or lacking confidence; unsettled in mind or opinion

usage.sentence: Her gestures were slow and tentative and her eyes reflected deep mental confusion.

definition: compelling immediate action

usage.sentence: Out of the way! Out of the way! This is urgent!

definition: a condition that accompanies some event or activity

usage.sentence: He wondered how things might have turned out differently for him if he’d had more faith, a different name, or been born to different circumstances.

definition: begin or get started

usage.sentence: We passed a few sad hours until eleven o’clock, when the trial was to commence.

definition: occurring in or belonging to the present time

usage.sentence: Former Emperor Akihito, the father of the current emperor, was the first member of the imperial family to marry a commoner.

definition: showing extreme urgency or intensity because of great need

usage.sentence: Was I so desperate to survive that I would steal bread from a sick boy?

definition: broad in scope or content

usage.sentence: My vocabulary is just not as extensive, and sometimes I get stuck.
usage.source: I Am Not Your Perfect Mexican Daughter

definition: moody and sorrowful

usage.sentence: She looked glum after that, and I felt sorry that I’d crushed her hopes.

definition: a contorted facial expression

usage.sentence: He stilled, then slowly curled into a ball, his face set in a fierce grimace of pain.
usage.source: The Kill Order (Maze Runner, Book Four; Origin)

definition: of or characteristic of low rank or importance

usage.sentence: The author, Mary Wollstonecraft, argued that women weren’t naturally inferior to men but lacked educational opportunities that allowed them to achieve equality.

definition: dried out by heat or excessive exposure to sunlight

usage.sentence: “Pa, try to take some water,” she’d say, lifting his head and holding a glass to his cracked, parched lips.

definition: drop sharply

usage.sentence: Then the rotten old floor collapsed, and the boys plummeted into the basement.

definition: status established in order of importance or urgency

usage.sentence: Our highest priority is the health and safety of our fans, staff, and local community.

definition: narrate or give a detailed account of

usage.sentence: As we rode, he recounted tale after tale of their bravery and cleverness.

definition: coming back

usage.sentence: His studies were also interrupted by recurring illness, which was to plague him all his life.

definition: search haphazardly

usage.sentence: She bends down and rummages in one of the cupboards behind her desk until she pulls out a bag of pretzels.
usage.source: The Benefits of Being an Octopus

definition: showing little if any change

usage.sentence: It’s surprisingly stable; it doesn’t really change over time.

definition: a piece of ground having specific characteristics

usage.sentence: The path is still pretty wide, wide enough for horses, but the terrain around us is getting rockier, the path twistier.
usage.source: The Knife of Never Letting Go

definition: serve as the medium for sending something

usage.sentence: Art, for Denes, is a way of ordering the world, of transmitting ideas, of offering other people new ways of looking and thinking.

definition: a mental position from which things are considered

usage.sentence: And this time I want you to come ready to speak up. I think your viewpoint is going to be particularly valuable.
usage.source: The Benefits of Being an Octopus

definition: capability of providing a clear unobstructed view

usage.sentence: Snow begins, thick and wet, making visibility even more difficult.

definition: shrink, as with a loss of moisture

usage.sentence: Flowers withered, insects shriveled, and fish died in their tanks.
